meanings.sent1: She kept mislearning the multiplication tables, getting the answers wrong.
meanings.sent2: He realized he was mislearning the lyrics to the song and decided to look them up.
meanings.sent3: The robot mislearning how to dance was quite a sight to see.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a broken compass, constantly mislearning the directions.
meanings.sent5: The child's mislearning of basic math concepts was hindering his progress in school.

meanings.definition: The act of acquiring incorrect knowledge or understanding.
meanings.sent1: Mislearning can lead to confusion and mistakes in the long run.
meanings.sent2: The teacher noticed a pattern of mislearning among the students in the class.
meanings.sent3: The mislearning of historical facts resulted in a hilarious mix-up during the quiz.
meanings.sent4: In the world of illusions, mislearning can be a dangerous trap.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of mislearning can be far-reaching and impactful on one's life.
